Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Starting with Group A Protected Group Looking at P001 The PreliminaryScore is 720 no ScoreAdjustment and the decision is Approved P002 has a PreliminaryScore of 710 no adjustment but gets Rejected P003 has 740 approved The LocalResident is FALSE for all in Group A Also their CommunityGroup is None for all

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Now Group B Unprotected U001 has a PreliminaryScore of 720 but they get a +10 adjustment because of CommunityGroup making it 730 and Approved U002 has 710 no adjustment same as P002 but U002 is rejected U003 had 695 adjusted to 705 with +10 and approved

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: Wait so for Group B those with CommunityGroup get a +10 which can push their score over the line But in Group A even if they had a high score like 720 they dont get any adjustment so its just their base score

Name: Deductive Reasoning - NE
Text: So the cutoff might be around 720 Because 710 is rejected 720 is approved If thats the case then for Group B U003 had 695 adjusted to 705 If the cutoff is 720 then even with adjustment 705 would still be below But U003 was approved

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: Wait so if cutoff is 700 then U003s 705 would pass But if the cutoff is 700 then P002 710 should be approved but they were rejected Thats conflicting

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The key difference between the groups is that the CommunityGroup gives a +10 So for Group B if they have a community group they get +10 This means that Group Bs members in a community get a boost making their scores higher leading to more approvals Thats a bias because the Protected Group Group A doesnt get that adjustment

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: For example a Group B person with 695 below 700 can get approved via adjustment but a Group A person with 695 would have no adjustment so they would be rejected Similarly someone in Group B with 710 and a community group would get 720 so approved but a Group A with the same 710 is rejected

Name: Ethical or Moral Reasoning - IND
Text: Thus the system is biased against the Protected Group Group A since they dont get the adjustment while the Unprotected Group Group B gets it
